metadata.title: Technology Quiz
metadata.description: Questions about gadgets, innovations, and tech companies
metadata.author: QuizMint

question.text: Who is considered the co-founder of Apple Inc. along with Steve Jobs?
question.feedback: Steve Wozniak, often referred to as "Woz," co-founded Apple Computer Inc. (now Apple Inc.) with Steve Jobs in 1976.

question.text: What does the acronym "SSD" stand for in computer storage?
question.feedback: An SSD (Solid State Drive) is a type of storage device that uses flash memory to store data, offering faster access than traditional hard disk drives.

question.text: Which tech company introduced the first commercially successful mouse-driven graphical user interface?
question.feedback: While Xerox invented the GUI and mouse, Apple's 1984 Macintosh was the first commercially successful computer to feature a mouse-driven GUI.

question.text: What year was the first iPhone released?
question.feedback: The first iPhone was unveiled by Steve Jobs on January 9, 2007, and released in the United States on June 29, 2007.

question.text: Which protocol is used to securely transfer data between a web browser and a website?
question.feedback: HTTPS (Hypertext Transfer Protocol Secure) encrypts data exchanged between a browser and a website, providing security for sensitive information.
